pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:0.5_0: The training rule on containing rice
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:1.11_0: if he picks things out to give to others;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:1.12_0: if he picks things out to put it into someone else’s vessel;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:1.13_0: if it is a special curry;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:1.14_0: They burn in times of trouble,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:1.17_0: The third rule, the third training rule on fire, is finished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six ate almsfood picking here and there. ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:1.3.1_0: “‘I will eat almsfood in order,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:1.4_0: he should eat the almsfood in order;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, eats almsfood picking here and there, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
